author: davidein
content: Sitting down after huge staged intro. Probably 10 minutes away. Our table breaks first.

author: davidein
content: When I host a charity poker tourney, I make a point of trying to keep the speeches short.  Not here. We are seated. Shuffle up.

author: davidein
content: First break.  Fun watching everyone else play. I worked my folding muscle. Am up a trivial amount.

author: davidein
content: Won very nice pot from ELKY on a flopped set.

author: davidein
content: Second break. About 4.8 mm. Won a second good pot off Gus Hansen.

author: davidein
content: Dinner break. About $5.6 mm. Running good. Lots of adrenaline. :)

author: davidein
content: New table. 5.1 mm.  1 hour to go.

author: davidein
content: A bit of a tough hour. 3.8 mm.  Good nite.  Ready for tomorrow.

author: davidein
content:
@AlexBerenson 

This is right.  I am playing for City Year.

author: davidein
content: @AlexBerenson   Yes. But I will not send till after tourney.

author: davidein
content: Game on.  Won a couple small ones right away.

author: davidein
content: Favorable table draw to be wasted.  We are first to break.

author: davidein
content: Table break 4.7 mm

author: davidein
content: New table. Lots of good players. Chipping up 5.4 mm -- both Phil's and Gus. Should be fun.

author: davidein
content: On break. About $5.3. 26 left. They redraw the tables at 24. Too bad. I like playing these guys.

author: davidein
content:
Redraw pending.  5.4 mm. 

Having fun!

author: davidein
content: Very card dead. Whittled down to 4.4 mm at break.

author: davidein
content: Finally hit a big hand. Doubled up to over $8 mm.

author: davidein
content: Dinner break. Around $8 mm. A good time for a break.

author: davidein
content: Another card dead couple hours. Playing tight. Hanging in at $8 mm. Down to 11 players.   Gonna be awhile to get to 8, I think.

author: davidein
content: Final table. Ten players. They pay 9.  Up to 9.4 MM

author: davidein
content: In the money!

author: davidein
content: Down to 9.  Playing till one more person is out.

author: davidein
content: Down to 8. Game over...for tonight. 8.5 mm chips.

author: davidein
content: All set for intros.  No tweeting today...espn will keep everyone posted best. Should be fun.

author: davidein
content: A few thoughts about the One Drop and WSOP.  First: That was a lot of fun.  Just a great competition and I enjoyed every bit.

author: davidein
content: Second: Congrats to the winner.  He was the best man on that day.

author: davidein
content: Third: I want to thank my coaches: Brandon Adams, Phil Gordon and Mike McDonald.  You improved my game and my thinking.

author: davidein
content: Fourth: I want to thank my family, friends and partners for sweating me.  You know who you are.

author: davidein
content: Fifth:  I want to thank the various city year corp members for those awesome pictures. You guys are doing the real work in the trenches,

author: davidein
content: It was a great experience. But, I am all pokered out.  I have decided to skip the main event.  I look forward to future games.

author: davidein
content: A final thanks to everyone who cheered me on.  I felt the love.  No surprise: this will likely be my last tweet until next time.

author: davidein
content: RT @ChadQuotes: Einhorn (@DavidEin) was getting about 8-to-1 in the big blind there, but his hand was 3-2; The man knows Risk management ...

author: davidein
content: Apparently I have a twitter impersonator.  @Greenlightcap is not me.  I also have no plans to tweet about stocks.  :).

author: davidein
content: RT @PhilNoLimits: Hosting poker night for my friend @realmikefox tonight in New York.  Great guy and a great cause. Raised  3m+ in this  ...

author: davidein
content: Just landed in Vegas.  Ready for summer vacation part 1.  Playing in the one drop high roller starting tomorrow at noon.  😃😃😃😃

author: davidein
content: For this tourney i'm playing for @Playworks! Positive play + recess = less bullying & improved learning 4 all kids . Play on! #recesscounts

author: davidein
content: Signed up and ready.  Table 446, seat 5. (I like seat 5--good for those of us with bad eyes). Game on!

author: davidein
content: I don't immediately recognize anyone at my table...except Tom Dwan on my immediate left.  122 entrants so far.

author: davidein
content: Rough first two hours. Lost one big hand, but I think it a good lay down.   I have about 185k (started with 300).   Long way to go (I hope)

author: davidein
content: 2nd break.  Slow grind down. Not connecting with flops.  170k or so.

author: davidein
content: Early after the break.  Won a couple nice pots. 270k.

author: davidein
content: Phone died and needed recharge.  At dinner break with 451k.  Very good level with several nice pots.  Dinner not bad, either.

author: davidein
content: Two more hours.  I spent the time mostly donating chips slowly.  365k.  Table dynamic is improving, though.

author: davidein
content: All done....for the night.  Big second to last hand.  Ended with 519k.  In the game :)

author: davidein
content: First break.  500k in chips.  Not much happened.  Half the field is now out. My table will break soon.

author: davidein
content: I kept getting chipped down.  And the same guy showed up with AA twice in a row.  I busted around 70th.   Recess is over.  Back to school!

author: davidein
content: Back in Vegas for summer vacation part 2.  Today, I play the Main Event.  Back to history...White Sweatshirt with my kids' good hands.

author: davidein
content:
I'm playing the main event for the Michael J Fox foundation.  http://t.co/yYFVL2ZI4I. #cure Parkinson's.
5 hours to game time.

author: davidein
content: I'm good to go.  Table 371.  Such a rush...when patience is the prescription.  Makes it fun.

author: davidein
content: First break.  All small pots. Started with 30k now at 31.2k.  They play is sooo much faster than one drop. Get many more hands!

author: davidein
content: 2nd break.  Losing an evil amount of small pots.  21k.

author: davidein
content: Dinner break. AA on the button....won me the blinds.  I have yet to be in a good situation.  18k.  Time to eat.

author: davidein
content: Clawed my way back to 27k.  Only to go out on a turned flush over flush.  Really ugly tourney.  Ugh.

author: davidein
content: At @einhornscookies debut NY comic-con.  Epically delicious.  How big things get started! http://t.co/GjXnOUYyvY

author: davidein
content: Proud to celebrate those who #makebetterhappen @CityYear 25th! #cy25th http://t.co/Npl9sGMP4Z

author: davidein
content: 9 Days till #BigOneforOneDrop. This year I'm playing to fight poverty  for @RobinHoodNYC.  Looks like an impossible field.  Can't wait @WSOP

author: davidein
content: Half an hour to go!  Got sunglasses in @RobinHoodNYC colors.  All good to go.  Table draws coming up soon @wsop http://t.co/3NDKkpNTpk

author: davidein
content: They finally drew tables.  Old times: I have Sam Trickett on my right. Vanessa Selbst next to him. Fun stuff.  We may start soon.  :)

author: davidein
content: Ok. That didn't go well. First one out.  Couldn't make it an hour.   Tough hand.   ...  Try again at the main event. :(

author: davidein
content: Hand details:  with JJ in the small blind I reraised Trickett. Flop was j-6-2 rainbow. I bet he called. Turn was a 3. I bet he raised.

author: davidein
content: I reraised he called. River was a Q, I bet.  He shoved (not much more). I called and lost to 4-5.  Fun game.

author: davidein
content: @rolandoflondon I remember our play.  I needed your sense of humor, yesterday.  Rebuy?  You didn't even buy once 😃

author: davidein
content: @skiki13 75k into a 114k pot.

author: davidein
content: @skiki13 He was probably floating and hoping to push me off AK or AQ on most turns.

author: davidein
content:
After the One Drop left me feeling like Teddy KGB (I feel so unsatisfied)
http://t.co/w6PQrw4pc0, today I plan to last > 1 hr.

author: davidein
content: I've made it twice as far as in One Drop. Mission accomplished!  I'm practicing my folding muscle. Just below starting 30k

author: davidein
content: I'm a straight magnet.  My QQ ran into a 2-3-4 flop.  Opp had a-5.  I held my loss to 12k. 2nd break 18k left. I'm improving!

author: davidein
content: Flopped a set and got paid. 33k at dinner. Just Broke our table again. Too bad, I loved the second table.  New table feels very tough.

author: davidein
content: End of level 4.  Grinding higher. 45k

author: davidein
content: All done for the night. Very slow level. I end with 42,900.   Sleepy time.  We continue Tuesday.

author: davidein
content: Very tough level.  Did WELL to contain damage down to 14k b4 doubling up as  JJ held v AK. 31k.

author: davidein
content: KK doubles me up again vs QJ after a J flopped.  72k. Feeling happy to be here.

author: davidein
content: A couple absurd hands where I could have lost even more brought me down to 49k at end of level 7.

author: davidein
content: Getting ground down. 31k at the dinner break. Third table for me.

author: davidein
content: End of a good level. J8 in big blind doubled up vs AK button. On A88 flop. Then I finally hit a draw.  91k

author: davidein
content: I don't think I played great, but I would up with 99,700.  Day 3 for me is Thursday.  Gotta be pleased to still be here. G'nite.

author: davidein
content: First break.  No good cards that level and villain made trip 3s on the river with 7-3.  73k.  Staying patient.

author: davidein
content: Grind grind grind. 84k..fold fold fold fold fold.  You get the idea.  Second break

author: davidein
content: Slow played my KK and doubled up. 147k. :)

author: davidein
content: 165k.  Dinner break.

author: davidein
content: After running up to 225k, i lose with QQ and AA in the same orbit. 145k at the last break.

author: davidein
content: Done early for the night.  Volatile level.  All is well that ends well 174,500.  Back for more in the morning.

author: davidein
content: At first break.  Bad job flopping.  Down to 95k.

author: davidein
content: We are in the money.  @RobinHoodNYC gets whatever I win to fight poverty in New York!  Time to be a short stack warrior!

author: davidein
content: At the break.   I got short and doubled up.  Leaves me at 95k.

author: davidein
content: Another double up.  This time very lucky as AJ beats AQ. Almost 200k.

author: davidein
content: Dinner break.  I chipped up to 220k http://t.co/X6hXkyu2lI

author: davidein
content: One hand after I lay down 99 to an all in, I double up with AA over KK. 260k

author: davidein
content: Doubled again. Set of 6s cracks JJ.  500k. :)

author: davidein
content: My flirtation with an averagish stack was short lived.  I bag 284k and return tomorrow to continue my role as short stack warrior!

author: davidein
content: Good afternoon. a-10 suited flushes to crack KK and I double up. 510k.  Short stack warrior! @RobinHoodNYC

author: davidein
content: First break.  530k.   Watching paint dry.

author: davidein
content: Ok. Get this?  I call 300k with QQ to run into KK.  The board comes a2345 and we split the pot. Running good #shortstackwarrior

author: davidein
content: Chipping up.  Nice cards. 685k at second break. Less than 200 people left.  #shortstackwarrior

author: davidein
content: Sadly all done.  AJ vs AQ and I couldn't find another miracle.  Lots of fun and no TeddyKGB regrets.  173rd place 44,728 for @RobinHoodNYC

author: davidein
content: Every kid deserves a school powered by play because #PlayWorks. Thanks @Playworks for the great night!

author: davidein
content: Poker season!  Playing for @FacingHistory @WSOP. One Drop starts Sun.  Helping kids be #Upstanders & to stop hate http://t.co/gr5nfiFjFl

author: davidein
content: Ready to go! @FacingHistory @WSOP to support #FacingHistory http://t.co/gr5nfiFjFl. We start in moments. http://t.co/xa82iCMnYe

author: davidein
content: First break. Nothing exciting. Started with 300k. I have about 308k.  Table seems fine. People are quiet.

author: davidein
content: After a long period of card dead, I lost 1/3 of chips against a turned gutshot straight held by 5-4suited.  Well, better than last time. Ugh

author: davidein
content: Grounded down to 85k, doubled with AKo vs AQs, chipped up.  295k at the dinner break. Happy to be back in the game.

author: davidein
content: 4th break. 375k.  The highlight was all in with AK vs AK.  We spilt the pot and divided the blinds and antes!!  Cost of poker is going up.

author: davidein
content: My a9 cracked a very good player's KK and busted him.  Lucky me. 650k.  Half the field is gone.

author: davidein
content: Just when it looked fun. aQ on a q-10-5 flop. Ran into q-10.  Arghh.  Try again at the main event. A fun day.

author: davidein
content: Time to start the main event.  I hope to give the opponents some History to Face!  Shuffling up and dealing soon.

author: davidein
content: First break.  33k.  A fine table.  Made a tight fold.  I will never know if that was right.  k9 on a KkJxx board. Hmmm

author: davidein
content: Nice level. No setbacks. Won a nice pot on last hand of level j-10 vs 10-8 on a j98xx board. 47k

author: davidein
content: Didn't win a pot for 90 minutes. Went down to 30k.  Then hit two flops. 53k at the dinner break.

author: davidein
content: Lost 15k to a set of fours...and an hour later won a little more with my own set of fours. Win some - lose some.  $57k

author: davidein
content: Wow.  Busto meltdown. AJs with flop K10-9 with my flush draw into KK. No help.  Shortly later and short stacked A10 in JJ. Ugh. Next year.

author: davidein
content: Join @StartEmpathy celebrating young #changemakers w/ @think_it_up on tv tonight 8/7c! http://t.co/hdXPM3HYk6 #StartEmpathy @EinhornTrust

author: davidein
content: http://t.co/YbFkw7Xpwp

author: davidein
content: RT @EinhornTrust: Our ED @jennrothberg demonstrating how trusting relationships drive impact https://t.co/CfBsvBrkx6

author: davidein
content: I am about to land in Vegas for an early start to poker season. Super excited to play in the super highroller bowl starting Sunday #SHRBowl

author: davidein
content: I'm playing for @WelcomingUSA working to build #inclusive communities for everyone, including immigrants & refugees. #WelcomingCity #SHRBowl

author: davidein
content: Dressed and ready.  1 pm seems to be Morrow a suggestion. https://t.co/1qbqB7QLkT

author: davidein
content: 1 level in and I'm right where I started. At least table play is pretty quick.

author: davidein
content: Level 2.  Very dead. Lost the one flop I hit hard. I'm at 220k vs 300k to start.

author: davidein
content: Third break 165k.  Time to reverse the trend.  And time to stop running in straights

author: davidein
content: Pretty good round....till the last hand where I busted.  KK vs 87o.  Flop j8x all diamonds. We both have a diamond. Turn 8!

author: davidein
content: Look who is having dinner in Rye. https://t.co/NTwd7ZiHfq

author: davidein
content: Second chance for poker. Playing in the one drop for @WelcomingUSA.  It's a great time to support our immigrants. I will tweet chip updates.

author: davidein
content: First break. Started with 500k, now just over 600k. Just moved tables.  Frying pan to fire.

author: davidein
content: Second break. 700k.  Some fun hands.  Having fun.

author: davidein
content: Couldn't hit a thing.  Did great to reach dinner at 630

author: davidein
content: Card dead...except a set of aces. 4th break. 575j

author: davidein
content: Done for the night.  Played nicely.  Happy and tired.  1.1 million 😄😄

author: davidein
content: Icky round.  Chip and a chair. 550k.  Blinds getting big.  Time to go big 😄

author: davidein
content: Doubled up!  a-10s beats KQ. 1.3mm 😄. About 50 left

author: davidein
content: 1430000 at the second break.  Not exactly able to exhale.  But quite alive.

author: davidein
content: Oh my.  I busted.  My KQ ran into 77 on a k-10-7 flop.   Try the main event on Monday.  Too bad. Played well vs great players.

author: davidein
content: Game time.  Starting equipment!  Ready for fun. @WelcomingUSA https://t.co/yKnZRI424t

author: davidein
content: First break. Cards meh. Bracelet winner on my left.  49k.  Long ways to go.

author: davidein
content: Down to 44k, I made a move doomed to fail, then sucked out on the river. 63k

author: davidein
content: Second break. 64k.

author: davidein
content: Last hand b din.  I raise 800 from cut off with 10-8d Raiseto 2200. I call. Flop 972 flush draw. Get it all in vs 97. Turn 2 River 10 105k

author: davidein
content: To clarify: villain was all in. I had 25k more. 😄😄😄

author: davidein
content: I hero folded A♦️K♦️ after 3 betting 3500. Followed by a 4 bet 10500 from A♣️K♣️ and a 5 bet from A♥️A♠️. Running well and playing well 118k

author: davidein
content: End of level 4. 110k. Like my new table.

author: davidein
content: Hit a flush and busted a short stack who had pocket aces. 145k

author: davidein
content: Just folded J♥️J♦️after getting 3b by AA and 4 bet by KK.  Lost just 1300. 158k with 20 min to go

author: davidein
content: Paid off QQ vs my ak.  All done. 128,400.  Good night. Back on Wednesday 😄😄

author: davidein
content: No cards.  Patience.  114k.  First break.

author: davidein
content: Went almost the whole level without winning a pot post flop. Zero cards, zero flops. 86500.  Hanging and waiting.

author: davidein
content: Crazy round.  I went down to 25k. As the deck remained icy.  Then it turned my way.  And when it turned, it really turned. 170k dinner

author: davidein
content: I flop top set of jacks. The turn is an A.  It get in and I double someone up, when he has AA.

author: davidein
content: 5 hands later flop a set of 9s from the blinds and pay off runner runner flush. 48k

author: davidein
content: At the break 45k

author: davidein
content: Nice solid level.  85k. We will play 1 more hour tonight.

author: davidein
content: All done. 114k.  Try some more starting noon.

author: davidein
content: All In with JJ vs QQ. A jack flops! I double up. Living on a borrowed life 170k

author: davidein
content: Extra life is shortish. On fumes. AQ loses to Q7s on an A flop against an eventual flush. 12k.  Time to make a move 😩

author: davidein
content: Out of fumes and out of chips. The fun ends. Time to go home. 😭

author: davidein
content: Thank you @FacingHistoryNY for such a great night and for helping students become upstanders https://t.co/gsBZYRc7HQ

author: davidein
content: @MaraJams    Thank You!  They are. Call my office 212 973 1900 and we will retrieve them.

author: davidein
content: RT @EinhornTrust: Thanks @LeapofReason! https://t.co/1mH8bJPPBz

author: davidein
content: @nofalsehoodsplz you don't need to.  You get 1 div share for every share you own.  If you just hold both, you'd be in the same place.

author: davidein
content: Poker time! Every day @cityyear shows up for kids & helps them succeed. I'm Competing in #SHRBowl to help more students & schools. Game on!

author: davidein
content: #SHRBowl   Starts tomorrow afternoon.  Bringing back my red jacket #cityyear. !!

author: davidein
content: Starting now.  #SHRBowl    Let's have a good game and win some for #cityyear https://t.co/xPRWb3krAe

author: davidein
content: First break.  Played very few hands. One well took me to 330K...1 bad flop and back to 305k.  Started at 300k.  Early going

author: davidein
content: Second break.  Lost a hand, won. Hand. 301k.  Playing tight. #SHRBowl

author: davidein
content: 3rd break.  Finally won a good pot on the last hand of the level.  $345k

author: davidein
content: Nice level.  Won a few good hands. Good image, playing well. 430k

author: davidein
content: Chipped down. But limited the damage. Still playing well.  Would be nice to hit a hand.  Didn't happen that level. 365k after 5 levels

author: davidein
content: End of level 6. Won a decent pot against the star.  386 K.  One more to go tonight.

author: davidein
content: After getting ground down....good cards and missing missing missing. I finally turn a flush on second last hand and win vs a set. 483k nite!

author: davidein
content: Proud to partner with @cityyear to help students get along better and reach for their dreams. Playing for them today at #SHRBowl on Day 2

author: davidein
content: Just about to start day 2.  I'm on the TV table.  30 minute delay.  So broadcast starts in half and hour #cityyear #SHRBowl #me-vs.-talent

author: davidein
content: 1st break. 400k.  Nothing good

author: davidein
content: Great level.   Cards cards cards!!! And a bluff.  And a plug for my daughter!  And a bigger plug for #cityyear.  630k!!! 😄

author: davidein
content: Good level. Still getting some cards...unlike yesterday.  Lost a couple small flips.  But overall good spot. 710k

author: davidein
content: Running strong.  Next break 830k!!!

author: davidein
content: Next level 959k.  Running good. Having fun

author: davidein
content: End of level 13.  Some ups and downs and more chips at risk than before. 1,025,000.  table got tougher.  1 level to go tonight.

author: davidein
content: A brutal level. I kept getting AK and it didn't turn out well.  Finished with 685k.  Plenty of chips to compete for #cityyear tomorrow

author: davidein
content: @realcharder30 Day 3.  Starting 685k which is 10 out of remaining 19 players.  Not at the tv table so you all can c… https://t.co/d11yme9dsE

author: davidein
content: Day 3 starting. 685k which is 10th out of 19.  No TV table to start so you can all concentrate on your day jobs 😄😄.  #cityyear

author: davidein
content: Lost a number of small pots. Bad cards no flops....until flopping bottom set and doubling up 900k. level 15 ending

author: davidein
content: We are down to 14.  Two tables. I'm moving to the TV table.  925k still

author: davidein
content: I got all my chips in very good. But, back luck hit.  That was a good tourney.  Sorry to go. #SHRBowl #cityyear

author: davidein
content: #wsop today! I'm playing for @WelcomingUSA working to build #inclusive communities for all, including immigrants & refugees. #WelcomingCity

author: davidein
content: First break lost a tough hand with aK vs Aq on AxxxQ board. 38k

author: davidein
content: Went down to 21k after being bluffed and then turning 2 PR vs a set. Came back turning a set of my own. 33k. 2nd break.

author: davidein
content: Well nothing went right today. Lost a lot with aK on a K368q board to k3.  Then 3 bet jammed with qQ got called by 99, who hit a set. Ugh

author: davidein
content: @Joebtracy Yes. When you jam and lose, you go look for dinner and think about the offseason.

author: davidein
content: @tradenator I don't tweet about the market.  Thx for the nice note, though

author: davidein
content: @cate_long    I don’t. 😄

author: davidein
content: I want to thank @elonmusk for the shorts. He is a man of his word!  They did come with some manufacturing defects.… https://t.co/SnQ7PQnKh9

content:

content:

content: @elonmusk @zerohedge @elonmusk #Tesla  #TSLA @zerohedge https://t.co/DrMk9SWjlf

content: Dear @elonmusk, Silence. https://t.co/7mzud757ZM

content:
Congrats Heather and Adam!!!

content: Dear @elonmusk @TSLA, More Boring Bonehead Questions https://t.co/yohjj7FQfj

author: davidein
content: Nobody expresses it better than Joan McCullough.  $TSLA @elonmusk https://t.co/cprfZCglTZ

author: davidein
content: Trying again...larger 😀.  part 1/3 $TSLA #ElonMusk https://t.co/0O94BFJTlz

author: davidein
content: Trying again larger 😀 Part 2/3 $TSLA #ElonMusk https://t.co/Y8eEkctCca

author: davidein
content:
Trying again larger.  3/3 $TSLA #ElonMusk 

Nobody expresses it better than Joan McCullough https://t.co/CeTUdlCbYC
